body_html: There's also an engineering reason to keep them separate, which is that it makes it easier to tell if you had an onnx only change (if all the changes are in test/, you don't know if it was a pytorch change or an onnx change).
body_text: There's also an engineering reason to keep them separate, which is that it makes it easier to tell if you had an onnx only change (if all the changes are in test/, you don't know if it was a pytorch change or an onnx change).
body: There's also an engineering reason to keep them separate, which is that it makes it easier to tell if you had an onnx only change (if all the changes are in test/, you don't know if it was a pytorch change or an onnx change).
